org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io

Class TextInputFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.FileInputFormat<OT>
      • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.DelimitedInputFormat<Record>
        • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.DelimitedInputFormat
          • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.TextInputFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, InputFormat<Record,FileInputSplit>

    public class TextInputFormat
extends DelimitedInputFormat
    Base implementation for an input format that returns each line as a separate record that contains only a single string, namely the line.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • configure

        public void configure(Configuration parameters)
        Description copied from class: DelimitedInputFormat
        Configures this input format by reading the path to the file from the configuration andge the string that defines the record delimiter.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface InputFormat<Record,FileInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        configure in class DelimitedInputFormat<Record>
        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration object to read the parameters from.
        See Also:
        InputFormat.configure(org.apache.flink.configuration.Configuration)

      • readRecord

        public Record readRecord(Record reuse,
                         byte[] bytes,
                         int offset,
                         int numBytes)
        Description copied from class: DelimitedInputFormat
        This function parses the given byte array which represents a serialized key/value pair. The parsed content is then returned by setting the pair variables. If the byte array contains invalid content the record can be skipped by returning false.
        Specified by:
        readRecord in class DelimitedInputFormat
        Parameters:
        reuse - The optional reusable holder for the line that is read.
        bytes - The serialized record.
        offset - The offset where to start to read the record data.
        numBytes - The number of bytes that can be read starting at the offset position.
        Returns:
        returns whether the record was successfully deserialized
